intro: Alsine biflora var. rigidula, commonly known as rigid alsike, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
